Beijing(visible, city, mutual elements,:
- First image: [landmark]
- Second image: [landmark]
- Relation: historical
- Explanation: Both the Great Wall of China and the Forbidden City are iconic landmarks in China, representing significant historical and cultural heritage. The Great Wall is a series of fortifications made of stone, brick, tamped earth, wood, and other materials, generally built along an east-to-west line across the historical northern borders of China. The Forbidden City, on the other hand, was the Chinese imperial palace from the Ming dynasty to the end of the Qing dynasty. It is located in the center of Beijing, China, and served as the home of emperors and their households, as well as the ceremonial and political center of Chinese government for almost 500 years.
